title: Trump says US will reopen commercial airspace over Venezuela
content: US President Donald Trump announced the reopening of commercial airspace over Venezuela, allowing Americans to travel to the country soon. This move follows initial steps to restore diplomatic ties, including deploying temporary staff to the US Embassy. American Airlines plans to resume flights, reconnecting families and fostering business between the nations after a diplomatic breakdown in 2019.

title: ‘Paying too much interest’: Trump to announce Fed chair nominee next week, replacing Jerome Powell
content: President Trump announced he will name his nominee for the next Federal Reserve chair next week, replacing Jerome Powell. Trump has repeatedly criticized current interest rates as "unacceptably high" and hurting the economy. He is considering four individuals for the crucial role.

title: Vinod Khosla gives 230-word-long reply to Elon Musk
content: Billionaire Vinod Khosla fired back at Elon Musk on X, dismissing Musk's defense against racism accusations by citing his partner's Indian heritage. Khosla accused Musk of promoting a racially exclusionary agenda and urged him to focus on the substance of his public commentary rather than invoking family ties.

title: Quote of the day by stoic philosopher Seneca: 'But when you are looking on anyone...'
content: Seneca, a Roman philosopher, offered Stoic principles for navigating life's challenges. His teachings, emphasizing virtue and controlling one's reactions, remain relevant today.  Seneca's emphasis on time management, emotional regulation, and genuine trust in friendships provides practical guidance for modern life.

title: Peter Thiel to Europe: You can never have a Google, Microsoft, or Amazon, because you fear…
content: Billionaire Peter Thiel argues European tech founders are too risk-averse, cashing out early instead of pursuing global scale. He contrasts this with Silicon Valley's embrace of failure, citing Mark Zuckerberg's rejection of a $1 billion Facebook offer.  Venture capital data shows the US significantly outpaces Europe in funding and large investment funds, highlighting a persistent gap.

title: Dhurandhar OTT release announced makers skip promotions for debut
content: Get ready to binge-watch Ranveer Singh’s 'Dhurandhar' on Netflix! After a staggering Rs 1300 crore at the box office, this gripping espionage thriller is making waves online in Hindi, Tamil, and Telugu. Director Aditya Dhar is thrilled about this new journey for the film, encouraging everyone to join the adventure and uncover the secrets packed into this epic saga.

title: WWE Royal Rumble 2026 predictions: Will Cena, Rock or Jericho appear?
content: The 2026 Royal Rumble in Riyadh is igniting fan excitement, with speculation rife about legendary returns. While John Cena has officially retired, a surprise cameo remains a possibility. Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson's Hollywood commitments make his appearance uncertain, but a milestone moment is not ruled out.

title: Bo Bichette loss to Mets angers Phillies fans as Dombrowski takes heat
content: Bo Bichette signed with the New York Mets on January 20, 2026, leaving the Philadelphia Phillies empty-handed. Phillies president Dave Dombrowski publicly said losing Bichette was a “gut punch.” Philadelphia re-signed catcher J.T. Realmuto but did not land that big free agent bat. Fans and analysts are now debating whether the Phillies’ winter was a success or not.

title: How Canadian PM Mark Carney's China visit 'resets' what Justin Trudeau tried in 2017
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney's visit to China signals a significant shift in policy, with the PM stating China is a more predictable trading partner than the US. This realignment comes as Canada seeks to strengthen ties with Beijing, focusing on trade, energy, and agriculture, despite past diplomatic tensions stemming from the Huawei CEO's arrest.

title: Tariff war, AI bubble: Crisis worse than 2008 looming? Economic Survey explains what India should do
content: Fundamentally, factors that shape the trade policy are changing. It is now majorly about security and political considerations rather than efficiency or multilateral rules.

title: Texas MAGA turns heat on H-1B visa scheme; 'firms run by Indians' under lens
content: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton has launched a probe into alleged H-1B visa fraud by North Texas companies, suspecting "sham operations" and "ghost offices" that disadvantage American workers. This move, alongside a gubernatorial directive freezing new visa petitions, highlights a political battle within the Texas GOP, with implications for immigration and labor policy.

title: The Khamenei question: Can Trump's 'beautiful armada' take out Iran's Supreme Leader?
content: US President Trump is escalating pressure on Iran with a significant naval deployment and threats of severe retaliation for any attacks.  He's considering targeted strikes, even on top leadership, aiming for a regime change similar to Venezuela.  Iran warns of a powerful response, while regional allies express deep concern over potential escalation and instability.

title: Thierry Henry and Andrea Rajacic net worth, wealth and love story
content: Thierry Henry became a football legend with clubs like Arsenal and Barcelona, then stayed in the game as a coach and TV expert. By early 2026, his net worth is estimated around $125–135 million. His long-time partner Andrea Rajacic, who works in fashion, has her own income. Together, they share a quiet family life and a combin

title: Taylor Swift leans on Travis Kelce as wedding plans stall amid legal issues
content: Travis Kelce has become a steady source of support for Taylor Swift as she navigates emotional strain linked to ongoing legal troubles around her inner circle. While staying publicly silent, Swift has leaned on Kelce’s guidance to protect her peace, set boundaries, and address personal tensions directly, even as wedding plans remain on pause.

title: Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce threat case sees new development
content: Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce might have had a pretty poor season on the field but the two have also been dealing with a shocking threat to their lives.While the threat was issued in 2024 by a man named Aaron P. Brown, the controversial case has now taken a shocking turn as both the Kansas City Chiefs' players deal with the offseason drama.

title: EU designates Iran's military a terrorist outfit; Tehran calls move 'spite-driven'
content: The European Union has designated Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps as a terrorist organization, citing its role in killing thousands of its own citizens. This move, supported by previously hesitant member states like France and Italy, follows a brutal crackdown on nationwide protests. Iran's military condemned the EU's decision as "irresponsible and spite driven."

title: Youhana, Younis, Butt… but not enough: When Irfan Pathan's hat-trick couldn't save India in Pakistan
content: Twenty years ago in Karachi, India vs Pakistan Test cricket saw an unforgettable opening day.  Irfan Pathan's hat-trick left Pakistan at 0 for 3, but Kamran Akmal's brilliant 113 led a remarkable comeback. Despite India's initial advantage, Pakistan secured a massive 341-run victory, clinching the series 1-0, a testament to cricket's unpredictable nature.

title: Understanding 'Carpet area' as per the RERA Act and what it covers
content: The RERA Act of 2016 introduced a clear definition of carpet area, specifying it as the net usable floor area within an apartment, excluding external walls, service shafts, and exclusive outdoor spaces. This standardization brought transparency to real estate transactions, ensuring buyers understand their actual living space and preventing disputes arising from varied builder calculations.

title: Honouring Dada's 'last wish' or Mahayuti? NCP in Catch-22; calls for Sunetra to step in
content: Ajit Pawar's sudden demise has plunged the NCP into a crisis, facing a potential merger with Sharad Pawar's faction and crucial decisions on alliances. The party grapples with leadership vacuum and cabinet representation, with Sunetra Pawar emerging as a potential successor to her husband's political legacy.

title: Handshake row at Australian Open: Sabalenka beats Svitolina, no handshake after SF
content: Belarus's Aryna Sabalenka stormed into her fourth Australian Open final, defeating Ukraine's Elina Svitolina 6-2, 6-3.  Sabalenka will face Elena Rybakina for the title, having not dropped a set throughout the tournament.  Svitolina, meanwhile, reflected on the ongoing conflict in her homeland, putting the match into perspective.

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo’s mom sparks Miami trade rumors with one post
content: Panic grips Milwaukee as Giannis Antetokounmpo's mother posts a throwback photo from the Miami Heat arena amid trade rumors. With the Bucks struggling, Giannis reportedly seeks a new home, and his mother's post fuels speculation of a franchise-altering move.  The league watches closely as this potential trade could reshape power dynamics.

title: Ranji Trophy: Pollution disrupts play, players forced to wear masks in Mumbai vs Delhi match
content: Dust and pollution from a nearby construction site disrupted play during a Ranji Trophy match at Mumbai's BKC ground. Players, including Sarfaraz Khan and Musheer Khan, were forced to wear masks for about 30 minutes due to the unhealthy air quality. The Mumbai team management has requested the MCA to address the issue with the Maharashtra Pollution Control Board.

title: Ajit Pawar death: Fatal Baramati accident exposes VIP aviation risks
content: Ajit Pawar's tragic death in a charter plane crash highlights critical gaps in India's aviation safety for VVIP travel. The incident exposes how urgency and political influence can strain safety margins in the non-scheduled aviation sector, particularly at smaller airfields. This event demands a reckoning with regulatory oversight and operational discipline.

title: 'All is good': Tharoor meets Kharge, Gandhi - Inside details of nearly 2-hour meeting
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge and LoP Rahul Gandhi met with Shashi Tharoor to address internal concerns ahead of the Kerala assembly polls. The "constructive and positive" discussion aimed to quell speculation and ensure party unity. Tharoor emphasized moving forward together, dismissing discussions about a chief ministerial face.

title: FMGE January 2026 result released: Check direct link to download and key details here
content: The National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences has announced the Foreign Medical Graduate Examination December 2025 results. Candidates can now check their scores on the official NBEMS website. Those who qualified must attend document verification. Individual scorecards will be available soon. The results were declared on January 29, 2026.

title: RCB crush UP Warriorz by eight wickets to storm into WPL final
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured a dominant eight-wicket victory over UP Warriorz, propelling them into the WPL final. Grace Harris's explosive 75 off 37 balls, supported by Smriti Mandhana's fifty, chased down UPW's 143 with ease. Nadine de Klerk's four-wicket haul was crucial in restricting the opposition earlier.

title: 'Pressure isn't an excuse': Yuzi Chahal goes hard at Sanju Samson after repeated failures
content: Yuzvendra Chahal has voiced strong opinions on Sanju Samson's batting form. He believes pressure is not a valid reason for Samson's consistent failures. Chahal highlighted that Samson has had multiple chances in the ongoing series. He noted that Ishan Kishan is performing well and waiting for an opportunity. Chahal suggested team management consider replacing Samson if struggles continue.

title: Cardi B emerges as top guest for Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl LX halftime show
content: A nationwide fan poll reveals Cardi B as the most desired guest performer for Bad Bunny's Super Bowl LX halftime show. Fans overwhelmingly want to hear their hit song "I Like It," and her potential appearance is further fueled by her relationship with Patriots player Stefon Diggs.

title: Big AI push: PM Modi meets CEOs of top firms; lays out roadplan, flags pitfalls
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi engaged with Indian AI leaders, emphasising ethical use, data security, and indigenous solutions for national growth. He highlighted India's digital prowess, citing UPI as a model for AI development. The interaction aimed to foster collaborations and accelerate India's AI mission, with industry leaders backing self-reliance goals.

title: NRAI says 'no safety issue' as Bangladesh team set to travel India
content: NRAI Secretary General Pawan Kumar Singh assures no safety concerns for the upcoming Asian Rifle and Pistol Championships in India, highlighting full government backing. A small delegation from Bangladesh, including one shooter and coach, will participate, with strict NRAI security protocols in place for weapons handling.

title: Economic Survey 2025–26 presents snapshot of India's 'Reform Express': PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday said that the Economic Survey 2025–26 offers a comprehensive picture of India’s growth journey, calling it a snapshot of the country’s "Reform Express". The survey highlights India's shift towards strategic resilience and global integration. Initiatives are boosting manufacturing competitiveness and accelerating the nation's development.

title: 'They don't have guts': Ajinkya Rahane mocks Pak over T20 World Cup boycott threat
content: Pakistan's participation in the T20 World Cup 2026 is uncertain. The Pakistan Cricket Board may withdraw in protest of Bangladesh's exclusion.  The ICC has warned Pakistan of severe disciplinary actions if they fail to participate.  Former Indian captain Ajinkya Rahane expressed skepticism about Pakistan's boycott threat.  The final decision rests with the Pakistani government.

title: A failed chemistry exam & a Nobel for DNA repair: What Tomas Lindahl’s story tells us
content: Once failed in high school chemistry due to a teacher’s judgement, Tomas Lindahl later reshaped the same discipline. Awarded the 2015 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for his pioneering DNA repair research, Lindahl’s journey from classroom setback to scientific distinction highlights how early academic assessments can misjudge potential—and why education must look beyond grades to recognise long-term talent.

title: 'Rich military heritage on display': PM Modi attends Beating Retreat 2026
content: The Beating Retreat ceremony will formally conclude Republic Day celebrations today. This event showcases India's military heritage and the armed forces' dedication. Bands from the Army, Navy, and Air Force will perform at Vijay Chowk. Traffic restrictions are in place in central Delhi to ensure the ceremony proceeds smoothly. Commuters are advised to use alternative routes.

title: HC questions govt. for not setting up heritage commission
content: High Court orders the publication of a notification in leading dailies, calling for applications for the post of chairman of the commission

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: A statement of fiscal resilience in a volatile federal framework
content: The Budget presented by State Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal serves as a blueprint for navigating global disorder and domestic fiscal challenges. It prioritises revenue-led fiscal consolidation, prudent debt management, inclusive welfare, and innovative investments

title: Heavy security arrangements in Thiruvananthapuram ahead of India-New Zealand T20I match
content: As per the security protocol, the stadium and its surrounding areas have been declared a temporary ‘Red Zone’ on January 30 and 31

title: Medical college doctors condemn ‘neglect’ in Kerala Budget
content: KGMCTA says while a host of populist measures were announced for all categories of government servants, the doctors were denied even their pay arrears

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: New scheme to provide safe lodging for women employees of IT parks
content: Budget earmarks ₹950.89 crore for labour and labour welfare sector, an increase of ₹436.45 crore as compared to last year

title: Prakash Raj pushes for Palestinian films at BIFFes, Siddaramaiah stops short of commitment
content: Speaking in broad strokes, the Chief Minister reiterated that BIFFes aims to provide a platform to understand politics, life, equality and the suffering across countries

title: Religious fervour peaks as Sammakka ceremonially placed on Gadde at shrine, devotee influx set to surge
content: Earlier, following Mulugu Superintendent of Police firing a few rounds into the air, Koya priests, led by Chief Priest Kokkera Krishnaiah, brought down the presiding diety from Chilakalagutta after performing traditional secret rituals in accordance with Koya tribal customs

title: Economic Survey calls for fiscal flexibility for the Centre, cautions States against worsening finances
content: The Economic Survey argued that, while the Centre has managed to substantially improve its fiscal deficit ratios since the COVID-19 pandemic, the States have seen their finances worsen over this period due to falling revenue and higher spending on unconditional cash transfers

title: Minor Kashmiri hawker assaulted in Dehradun
content: The victim sustained multiple injuries, including a fractured arm, in the assault; While his cousin escaped with minor injuries

title: Palaniswami rejects Panneerselvam’s offer to rejoin AIADMK
content: “There is no place for Mr. Panneerselvam in the party,” the AIADMK general secretary says; In his sharpest attack on TVK leader Vijay, Mr. Palaniswami says, “After the Karur stampede, Mr. Vijay could not even visit the families of the deceased. Then, what is the meaning of running a political party?”

title: Death toll in Kolkata warehouse fire rises to 21 with ‘27 reported missing’
content: Rescue teams are scouring the fragile burnt out structure amid mounting fears that the toll will rise

title: Occupants of now demolished illegal sheds in encroached government land in Kogilu layout not shifting to temporary shelters, govt. tells Karnataka HC
content: “Majority of illegal sheds were put up during 2024-25 and no structure existed on this land prior to 2014”

title: Cutting carbon emissions should not be top priority: Economic Survey
content: The Survey in its past iterations has framed climate change as a global risk that threatens food production, livelihoods and has called upon countries - at various times - to “support” developing countries such as India to transition away from fossil fuel

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: ₹27.82 cr. allocation for environment and habitat sector
content: It includes the allocation of ₹10.82 crore for the Department of Environment and Climate Change, ₹13 crore for the Kerala State Biodiversity Board, ₹3 crore for the Kerala State Pollution Control Board, and ₹1 crore for the Kerala State Climate Change Adaptation Mission

title: Farmer kills leopard in fight for survival, booked under Wildlife Act
content: The 60-year-old farmer fought off the big cat with a sickle and a spear after it pounced on him and his son in a village in Gujarat; forest officials register case under the Wildlife (Protection) Act, 1972

title: Economic Survey points to decrease in agricultural growth in 2025-26
content: Average annual growth rate over last five years was 4.4% but the second quarter of current financial year saw 3.5% growth, which is less than the average

title: Economic Survey highlights Tamil Nadu’s ‘Thozhi’ hostels for working women and measures aimed at coastal restoration
content: These hostels offer a blueprint for States seeking to expand women workforce, the Economic Survey says, even while lauding TN-SHORE that is meant to enhance coastal biodiversity and protection

title: Madras High Court dismisses case against ECR widening project
content: Justice P.T. Asha rejects the writ petition filed by Bhopal-based Dilip Buildcon against Hyderabad-based KNR Constructions

title: A.P. CM tells officials to expedite NH projects worth ₹1.40 lakh crore
content: Officials instructed to ready plans to convert the two-lane highways into four or six-lane ones and complete the projects worth ₹42,194 crore by the end of 2027

title: Religious fervour peaks as Sammakka is brought down from Chilakalagutta hillock at Medaram
content: Devotees jostled for a glimpse of the procession as it moved towards the Medaram tribal shrine after Mulugu Superintendent of Police Sudhir R. Kekan fired a few rounds into the air from an AK-47 assault rifle as a mark of respect to the tribal deity as part of a long-standing tradition followed since 1996

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: industry forums welcome Budget despite concerns over fund mobilisation
content: Social development thrust and big-ticket infrastructure promises drew praise from trade bodies and professional groups, even as questions were raised about implementation capacity, allocations for startups, and the impact on ease of doing business

title: Health Dept. releases ₹128.43 cr. NHM funds to all districts in A.P.
content: The funds were part of the final instalment under the NHM budget to the State for the 2025–26 fiscal year, says official

title: PMAY households in A.P. to get energy-efficient appliances
content: A.P. State Housing Corporation Limited, A.P. State Energy Efficiency Development Corporation and Energy Efficiency Services Limited sign MoU for integrating energy-efficient appliances with the PMAY in Andhra Pradesh

title: Cancer becoming a ‘public health concern’ in Kerala, says Economic Review 2025
content: ‘Delays in early detection, huge treatment costs, minimal treatment centres and lack of awareness contribute to high mortality; lung cancers in males and females showed an increasing trend between 2010 and 2020’

title: Unconditional cash transfers putting State finances at risk, Economic Survey 2025-26 warns
content: The Survey noted that aggregate spending on UCT programmes, particularly for women, is estimated at about ₹1.7 lakh crore for the current financial year 2025-26

title: Travel operators seek relocation of toll plazas at Bengaluru entry points
content: In a letter addressed to Deputy Chief Minister D. K. Shivakumar recently, the association said that the residents of both Bengaluru Urban and Rural districts are being forced to pay toll charges even for short-distance daily travel into the city for work, education, healthcare and business.

title: QR code wristbands help reunite two missing children at Medaram Maha Jatara
content: When a lost child is found, the QR code on the wristband can be scanned using a smartphone, which immediately displays the registered contact number, enabling the police or members of the public to inform the parents and ensure the child is safely reunited, IGP, Multizone-2, explained

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: ₹20 cr. allocated to medical college headlines Palakkad’s gains
content: Pattambi Assembly constituency has also received major allocations, including ₹75 crore for a flyover bypass

title: Economic Survey suggests marketing ban and highest GST on ultra-processed foods to tackle obesity
content: Restrictions may also be levied on marketing of infant and toddler milk and beverages to tackle rising obesity

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: fisheries sector secures ₹239-crore outlay
content: Budget outlines three-pronged strategy focussing on safety and social security of fisherfolk, coastal rehabilitation, and the expansion of inland fisheries

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: Allocation for Aswasakiranam project hiked to ₹100 crore
content: ₹3 crore has been earmarked for commencing ‘Anpu Veedu’ scheme, which envisages establishment of care homes for the intellectually challenged at the block level. Day care facility and respite care facilities will be provided through the scheme

title: A.P. Excise Department announces re-notification of 301 bar licences
content: Applications will be accepted in online, hybrid or offline modes until 6 pm on February 4 and the draw of lots will be held by District Collectors on February 5

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: State Budget gives major boost to Malabar’s development
content: Wayanad Development Package, Beypore Uru tourism project, Kerala Administrative Tribunal bench at Thalassery, Wayanad tunnel road and an international sports hub in Kannur among projects mentioned in Budget

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: Increased allocation for tourism sector;  ₹5 cr. for heliport at Kumarakom
content: A sum of ₹159 crore has been allocated for the renovation and development of basic infrastructure and other amenities in tourism centres

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: ₹100 crore earmarked for Regional Rapid Transit System
content: Technocrat E. Sreedharan has raised concerns that the RRTS’s multiple stops may diminish its efficiency compared to the proposed high-speed rail project.

title: Wetzel: How the odd Belichick HOF snub could get m...
content: One thing could make Bill Belichick even more suspicious about this situation: Robert Kraft could get voted in.

title: Pats Vrabel 'not' too worried about Maye's health
content: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel said Thursday that he's not too concerned about QB Drake Maye's injured shoulder as the team begins preparations for Super Bowl LX.

title: Sources: Hayes, Bryant accept slam dunk invites
content: Lakers center Jaxson Hayes and Spurs rookie Carter Bryant have accepted invitations to the NBA slam dunk contest at All-Star Weekend in Los Angeles, sources said.

title: KU expects Peterson to play vs. BYU, Dybantsa
content: Kansas expects to have Darryn Peterson available Saturday when the No. 14 Jayhawks welcome A.J. Dybantsa and No. 13 BYU to Allen Fieldhouse.

title: Ravens' Minter: I want to build bond with Lamar
content: Ravens coach Jesse Minter said he's looking forward to building a relationship with quarterback Lamar Jackson.

title: Kennesaw St. coach blasts betting 'predators'
content: While Kennesaw State coach Antoine Pettway said he wasn't giving a pass to players who took bribes, he expressed more frustration with the ringleaders of college basketball's point-shaving scheme.

title: Survey: Parents a top reason youth coaches quit
content: Most of America's youth-sport coaches are feeling burned out and fed up with verbal harassment and abuse, mainly from parents of athletes, according to a national survey released Thursday by the U.S. Center for SafeSport.

title: USWNT legend Dunn, 33, announces retirement
content: United States women's national team great Crystal Dunn on Thursday announced her retirement from soccer at age 33.

title: Sen. Cruz against college athletes as 'employees'
content: Sen. Ted Cruz told ESPN it's critical that any federal law related to college sports includes a provision that prevents athletes from being deemed school employees.

content: Could George Pickens, Breece Hall and Malik Willis land big contracts? Here are the top 50 free agents heading into the offseason.

content: The four-time All-Star wasn't brought in to be a franchise savior, the Wizards say. He was brought in to cultivate the player they believe is their next one, former No. 2 pick Alex Sarr.

content: Will Teofimo Lopez Jr. solve Shakur Stevenson's defense and impose his offense? Or will Stevenson control the range, neutralizing Lopez's power?

content: In early Super Bowl LX betting, Jaxon Smith-Njigba leads all players in touchdown prop betting volume.

title: Iran Warns Of "Decisive Response" To Any US Attack
content: Iran will deliver an immediate response in case of an attack by the United States, the army spokesman said Thursday, warning that US military bases in the region or an aircraft carrier could be targets.

title: UN Urges 'Restraint' From Law Enforcement After US Protester Deaths
content: UN chief Antonio Guterres called Thursday for "restraint" from authorities towards protesters in the United States after immigration agents killed two US citizens this month demonstrating against deportation raids in Minneapolis.

title: Bangladesh, Pakistan Resume Direct Flights After 14 Years
content: Direct flights between Bangladesh and Pakistan resumed on Thursday after more than a decade, as ties warm between the two nations that have long had an uneasy relationship.

title: Economic Survey 2026 Highlights: GDP Growth Estimated At 7.4% This Fiscal
content: Parliament Budget Session 2026 Highlights: Nirmala Sitharaman presented economic survey of India in Lok Sabha today.

title: From Syria To Qatar: All US Military Bases In Middle East
content: Iranian retaliation for a US attack would likely target American forces in the Middle East, where Washington has tens of thousands of troops deployed on bases across the region.

title: Pakistan's Debt Crosses 70% Of GDP As Fiscal Deficit Blows Past Target
content: Pakistan's finance ministry has admitted that "public debt dynamics remained a key challenge" during the last fiscal year, as the increase in total public debt was "driven mainly by higher interest payments and exchange rate movements".

title: Farewell, Ajit Pawar: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Cremated With Full State Honours
content: The last rites of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister and NCP chief Ajit Pawar were held in his political stronghold, Baramati, with full state honours.

title: Girl, 13, Dies By Suicide In Gurugram, Diary Mentions Academic Pressure: Cops
content: A 13-year-old girl allegedly committed suicide by hanging herself in her room here, police said on Thursday.

title: India To Host Landmark India-Arab Ministerial After A Decade Tomorrow
content: India is set to host the second India-Arab Foreign Ministers' Meeting (IAFMM) on January 31, marking a significant diplomatic milestone.

title: KCR To Skip Questioning In Phone Tapping Case Today, Cites Civic Body Polls
content: Former Telangana chief minister and Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) president K Chandrashekar Rao (KCR) has officially requested a deferment from the special investigation team (SIT) regarding his scheduled appearance for questioning today.

title: EU Designates Iran's Revolutionary Guard As 'Terrorist Organisation'
content: The European Union agreed Thursday to designate Iran's Revolutionary Guard a "terrorist organisation" over a deadly crackdown on mass protests, sending a powerful message of condemnation to Tehran.

title: Oxford Study Says India To Be Among Worst Hit Amid Extreme Heat Risks
content: A new study from the University of Oxford suggests that intensifying global warming could push billions of people into dangerously hot living conditions within the next few decades.

title: Zilla Parishad, Panchayat Samiti Polls Rescheduled To Feb 7 In Maharashtra
content: Due to the 3-day state mourning declared following the untimely death of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, the schedule for the remaining phases of the general elections for 12 Zilla Parishads and 125 Panchayat Samitis has been revised.

title: Ukraine To Face -30 Degrees Celsius Freeze As Russia Attacks Energy Grid
content: Ukraine's state weather agency on Thursday forecast a drastic dip in temperatures to as low as minus 30C in coming days, as authorities race to restore heating and electricity services and President Volodymyr Zelensky warned of fresh Russian attacks

title: Trump Says Putin Agreed To Not Fire On Kyiv For A Week During Cold Weather
content: US President Donald Trump said on Thursday that Russian President Vladimir Putin agreed to not fire on Kyiv for a week due to cold weather.

title: "Major Strategic Mistake": Iran Blasts EU After Guards' Terror Designation
content: Iran reacted with fury on Thursday after the EU blacklisted the country's Revolutionary Guards as a terror group, as Tehran faced off with Washington after US President Donald Trump warned time was running out for a nuclear deal.

title: Special Leaves For Birthdays, Wedding Anniversaries For Karnataka Cops
content: In a move aimed at improving work-life balance and boosting morale among police personnel, the Karnataka State Police Headquarters has issued a circular permitting officers and staff to avail casual leave on their birthdays and wedding anniversaries.

title: "Let's See His Reaction": Woman's Reel-Making Day Inside Boyfriend's Jail
content: Raipur Central Jail, meant to be one of the most secure institutions in Chhattisgarh, is once again under a cloud after a sensational video surfaced showing a young woman freely recording a video inside the jail's visiting room.

title: Finance Minister To Table Sunday Budget: What It Means For Markets And Investors
content: For the first time in over two decades, the Union Budget will be presented on a Sunday. On February 1, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will table the government's annual financial statement for 2026 in the Lok Sabha at 11 am.

title: Blakeney goes from an NBA player to alleged game fixer
content: federal law enforcement unsealed criminal charges alleging Blakeney was one of the ringleaders in a u.s. college basketball gambling and game-fixing scandal involving 26 defendants . the indictment alleges Blakeney convinced NCAA players that his other co-conspirators would pay $10,000 to $32,000 in exchange for poor performances, sitting out of or removing themselves from games, and providing information about players' health .

title: The art of dealing with Trump: Playing along & hedging - has India cracked the code?
content: This is a challenging time for Australia. Our relationship with the United States has long been a pillar of our security and prosperity. While there has always been a gap between what Australia wanted the US to be and the reality, this is now a chasm. The Trump Administration's approach to global trade and to international norms means it is a different partner than it was It is in the nature of middle powers to try to bind great powers through rules and norms. We don't want to live in a might-makes-right world where great powers hold sway in their spheres of influence

title: War or peace: US, China are stuck in Thucydides Trap - can they find a way out?
content: The liberal economic order still matters, but its restraining power has weakened considerably Strategic accommodation remains theoretically possible but politically fragile
